com.github.fge.filesystem.provider

Class FileSystemProviderBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.nio.file.spi.FileSystemProvider
      • com.github.fge.filesystem.provider.FileSystemProviderBase

  • @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public abstract class FileSystemProviderBase
extends FileSystemProvider
    Base FileSystemProvider implementation

    Important note: in order to match the behaviour of the default filesystems, you should be aware of the following:

    • The copy operation will not perform recursive copies; if the source is a non empty directory, the operation fails with DirectoryNotEmptyException. This class enforces this behaviour if the source and target paths are not on the same filesystem; if they are, this is then delegated to your own copy implementation.
    • if the target path of a move operation exists and is a non empty directory, and you selected to replace the existing target path, the operation fails with DirectoryNotEmptyException; if the source and target paths are not on the same filesystem, this behaviour is enforced by this class; if they are on the same filesystem, this is delegated to your own move implementation.
    • The deletion operation (delete(Path) and FileSystemProvider.deleteIfExists(Path) do not perform recursive deletions; if the target is a non empty directory, this method throws DirectoryNotEmptyException.

    All methods of this class which accept options as arguments will check the validity of these options before performing the actual operation. Two exceptions are possible when checking options:

    • UnsupportedOptionException,
    • IllegalOptionSetException.
    See Also:
    FileSystemOptionsFactory, FileSystemDriver, FileSystemRepository.getDriver(Path)

      • newInputStream

        public final InputStream newInputStream(Path path,
                         OpenOption... options)
                                 throws IOException
        Open an input stream to an existing path

        This method checks the existence of the file before delegating the creation of the input stream to the relevant driver. The driver is also responsible to deal with the target not being a directory.

        Overrides:
        newInputStream in class FileSystemProvider
        Parameters:
        path - the path to open
        options - open options
        Returns:
        an input stream
        Throws:
        NoSuchFileException - file does not exist
        IOException - other I/O exception
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriver.newInputStream(Path, Set)

      • newOutputStream

        public final OutputStream newOutputStream(Path path,
                           OpenOption... options)
                                   throws IOException
        Open an output stream to a given path

        This class performs the following checks before delegating to the driver:

        • if StandardOpenOption.CREATE_NEW is specified and the file already exists, throws FileAlreadyExistsException;
        • if the file does not exist and StandardOpenOption.CREATE is not set, throws NoSuchFileException;
        • if the file exists and cannot be written to, throws AccessDeniedException.

        All other checks, such as for instance the target being a directory and not a file, are left to the driver.

        Overrides:
        newOutputStream in class FileSystemProvider
        Parameters:
        path - the path to open
        options - the set of open options
        Returns:
        an output stream
        Throws:
        FileAlreadyExistsException - StandardOpenOption.CREATE_NEW was specified but the target already exists
        AccessDeniedException - target exists but cannot be written to
        IOException - other I/O exception
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriver.newOutputStream(Path, Set)

      • newDirectoryStream

        public final DirectoryStream<Path> newDirectoryStream(Path dir,
                                       DirectoryStream.Filter<? super Path> filter)
                                               throws IOException
        Open a new directory stream from a target path

        This method checks that the target path exists and that the process has read access to it before delegating the directory stream creation to the driver.

        It is up to the driver to perform other checks (such as whether the target path is indeed a directory).

        Specified by:
        newDirectoryStream in class FileSystemProvider
        Parameters:
        dir - the path
        filter - a filter for directory entries
        Returns:
        a directory stream
        Throws:
        NoSuchFileException - target path does not exist
        IOException - other I/O exception
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriver.newDirectoryStream(Path, DirectoryStream.Filter)

      • delete

        public final void delete(Path path)
                  throws IOException
        Delete an entry on the filesystem

        This method will check whether the path actually exists before delegating to the driver.

        Recall: this operation does not perform recursive deletions. It is up to the driver to check whether the target is a non empty directory, and fail with DirectoryNotEmptyException if this is the case.

        Specified by:
        delete in class FileSystemProvider
        Parameters:
        path - the path to delete
        Throws:
        NoSuchFileException - target does not exist
        IOException - other I/O error
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriver.delete(Path)

      • copy

        public final void copy(Path source,
        Path target,
        CopyOption... options)
                throws IOException
        Copy a source path to a target path

        This method will do the following before performing the actual copy:

        • check that the source path exists;
        • if StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING is not set, check that the destination path does not exist.

        Il will then delegate to the relevant driver if and only if both paths are issued from the same FileSystem. If not, it performs the copy itself.

        Note that recursive copies are NOT performed by this method. Similarly, the driver SHOULD NOT perform recursive copies.

        Specified by:
        copy in class FileSystemProvider
        Parameters:
        source - the source path
        target - the target path
        options - the copy options
        Throws:
        NoSuchFileException - source path does not exist
        FileAlreadyExistsException - destination path exists and StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING was not set
        IOException - other I/O error
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriver.copy(Path, Path, Set)

      • move

        public final void move(Path source,
        Path target,
        CopyOption... options)
                throws IOException
        Move a source path to a target path

        This method will perform the following checks

        • if the source does not exist, throws NoSuchFileException;
        • if the target exists and StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING is not set, throws FileAlreadyExistsException.

        From this point on, it will delegate to the driver if and only if both the source and target are on the same filesystem. If this is not the case, TODO: implement metadata driver, for now it sucks

        Specified by:
        move in class FileSystemProvider
        Parameters:
        source - the path to move
        target - the destination path
        options - the set of copy options
        Throws:
        NoSuchFileException - the source does not exist
        FileAlreadyExistsException - the target exists and StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING was not set
        IOException - other I/O exception
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriver.move(Path, Path, Set)

      • isSameFile

        public final boolean isSameFile(Path path,
                 Path path2)
                         throws IOException
        Tell whether two paths represent exactly the same filesystem objects

        This method checks that both paths exist and have the same driver (which is the same as checking whether they are on the same filesystem, since no two filesystems share a driver), and then delegates to the driver to perform additional checks.

        Specified by:
        isSameFile in class FileSystemProvider
        Parameters:
        path - the first path
        path2 - the second path
        Returns:
        true if and only if both paths point to the same filesystem object
        Throws:
        NoSuchFileException - one, or both, paths do not exist
        IOException - error processing one, or both, paths
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriver.isSameFile(Path, Path)

      • isHidden

        public final boolean isHidden(Path path)
                       throws IOException
        Tell whether the filesystem object pointed by the path (if any) is hidden

        Typically, on Unix systems, this will be for paths whose last name component (if any) starts with a dot.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        path - the path to check
        Returns:
        true if the file is considered hidden
        Throws:

        See Also:
